companyProfile.companyDescription: Polycab India Limited is a manufacturer of wires and cables. It is engaged in fast-moving electrical goods (FMEG). Its segment includes Wires and cables, FMEG, and Other. Wire and cable segment is engaged in the manufacturing and selling of wires and cables. FMEG segment is engaged in fans, light-emitting diode (LED) lighting and luminaires, switches, switchgear, solar products, pumps, conduits, and domestic appliances. Other segment consists of the engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) business, which includes design, engineering, supply of materials, survey, execution and commissioning of power distribution, and rural electrification projects on a trunky basis. It is also in the business of engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) projects. It owns over 28 manufacturing facilities, located across the states of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Uttarakhand, and the union territory of Daman. Its products include Flexible Wires, Building Wires LV and MV Power Cables, and others.

recentNews.headline: Recommended stocks to buy today: Top stock picks by market experts for 9 June
recentNews.intro: Best stock to buy today: Discover the top stock picks by market experts Raja Venkatraman, Trade Brains Portal, MarketSmith India and Ankush Bajaj for Monday, 9 June.
recentNews.imagecaption: Stocks to buy today: Stocks recommended by market experts for Monday, 9 June.

recentNews.headline: Pros and cons of investing in Polycab India
recentNews.intro: Should investors consider the stock of Polycab India? Find out?
recentNews.imagecaption: Polycab India is one of India's leading manufacturers of cables and wires. (Image: Pixabay)

recentNews.headline: Polycab, KEI, Havells shares crash up to 15% as Adani Enterprises' entry heats up competition in cables & wires biz
recentNews.intro: The entry of Adani Group into the cables and wires market has led to a sell-off in shares of major companies like Polycab India and KEI Industries. Rising copper and aluminum prices further complicate the sector, raising concerns over increased competition and production costs.
recentNews.imagecaption: Polycab, KEI, Havells shares tumble up to 10% on Adani?s entry into cables & wires segment

recentNews.headline: This smallcap proxy stock is well insulated from UltraTech's shock to the cables & wire industry
recentNews.intro: While leading wire and cable companies deal with Ultratech's entry shock, here is a smallcap proxy play for your watchlist to ride the growing industry.
recentNews.imagecaption: The return ratios for the smallcap proxy stock are over 30%. (Image: Pixabay)

recentNews.headline: Polycab stock extends winning run to 4th session, gains 3.5% as Morgan Stanley sees 52% upside
recentNews.intro: Polycab India's shares rose 3.5% to  ?5078 as Morgan Stanley maintained its bullish outlook, citing strong demand in cables and wires. The firm has a target price of  ?7395, indicating a 52% upside potential despite recent volatility after UltraTech's market entry.
recentNews.imagecaption: Polycab India stock extends winning run to 4th session, gains 3.5% as Morgan Stanley sees 52% upside

recentNews.headline: Shares to buy: Riyank Arora of Mehta Equities suggests these three stocks to buy in short term
recentNews.intro: Shares to buy: Riyank Arora recommends buying these three stocks in the short term - Varun Beverages Ltd, Maruti Suzuki India Ltd, and Polycab India Ltd.
recentNews.imagecaption: Shares to buy: Riyank Arora recommends buying these three stocks in the short term - Varun Beverages Ltd, Maruti Suzuki India Ltd, and Polycab India Ltd.

recentNews.headline: Polycab India shares rise 5%: 4 key reasons why Jefferies expects 30% gains despite Ultratech's entry in C&W segment
recentNews.intro: Stocks to Buy: Polycab India shares surged nearly 5% on the BSE, defying fears from Ultratech's entry into the C&W segment. Experts from Jefferies highlight four key reasons for their positive outlook, projecting over 30% potential gains and a strong medium-term forecast despite market volatility.
recentNews.imagecaption: Stocks to Buy: Why Polycab may see upside despite competition UltraTech

recentNews.headline: Anxious about investing? These five debt-free mid-cap stocks could bring peace of mind.
recentNews.intro: Their debt-free status offers a solid foundation, shielding them from interest-rate shocks and refinancing risks. But let?s be clear?debt-free doesn?t mean risk-free.
recentNews.imagecaption: In the stock market, volatility and opportunity go hand-in-hand.

recentNews.headline: UltraTech Cement share price rebounds from 52-week low after THIS update; Do you own?
recentNews.intro: At 12:25 pm, UltraTech Cement shares was trading at  ?10,412.75, up over 3 per cent. The stock closed at  ?10,114 apiece on Friday.
recentNews.imagecaption: At 12:25 pm, UltraTech Cement shares was trading at  ?10,412.75, up over 3 per cent.

recentNews.headline: UltraTech's entry into wires and cables market: What it means for Polycab India
recentNews.intro: Polycab India?s stock plunged sharply as UltraTech Cement announced its entry into the cables and wires sector with a  ?1,800 crore investment. While investors fear intensified competition, will Polycab?s strong fundamentals help it withstand the potential disruption?
recentNews.imagecaption: UltraTech vs Polycab: Is India?s cables and wires Industry headed for a shake-up? (Image: Pixabay)
